meanings.definition: To surpass in striding or walking.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outstride her friends in the race.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outstride everyone on their morning walks.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident he could outstride him.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outstride her limitations propelled her forward.
meanings.sent5: The champion runner's ability to outstride his opponents was truly impressive.

meanings.definition: To outdo in walking or striding.
meanings.sent1: The marathon runner was able to outstride his competitors and win the race.
meanings.sent2: She knew she could outstride anyone when it came to hiking up the mountain.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to outstride the seal on land, but it was a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outstride his fears led him to take on new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's ability to outstride its prey is essential for survival in the wild.
